Column Comment.0: LEGAL LOCATION ID: unique identifier for the legal location
Column Comment.1: LOCATION TYPE: A reference table identifying the type of obj ect being given a legallocation. For example, node, well, ...
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: BLOCK: Character value between A - L. A grid area is divided into 6 blocks. A blockdescribes an area bounded by 5 minutes of latitude and by 7.5 minutes of longitude.
Column Comment.5: COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: unique identifier for the coordinate system.
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.7: EVENT SEQUENCE: one character code indicating the chronological sequence of asignificant drilling event or completion operation of a drill hole which yields a seperateand unique set of geology and/ or production data. (e.g., 0=original oil well,1=re-entry, etc.).
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.9: LETTER QUADRANGLE: Letter quadrangle, values between A: P. The PrimaryQuadrangle is divided into 16 lettered quadrangles. Describes an area bounded by 1degree of latitude and 2 degrees of longitude.
Column Comment.10: NTS LOCATION EXCEPTION: used to identify exceptional cases where there ismore than one hole on the smallest area described in the NTS survey system.
Column Comment.11: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.12: PRIMARY QUADRANGLE: Primary quadrangle number. Area bounded by 4 degreesof latitude and 8 degrees of longitude.
Column Comment.13: QUARTER UNIT: Quarter unit letter, values between a - d. A unit is divided into 4quarter units.
Column Comment.14: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.15: SIXTEENTH: Sixteenth number, values between 1: 16. Describes a grid areacontained within a rectilinear figure bounded by arcs of latitude and meridians oflongitude.
Column Comment.16: UNIT: Numeric values between 1 - 100. A block is divided into 100 units.
Column Comment.17: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.18: NODE IDENTIFIER: Unique identification number assigned to a specific point (node)
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
